headline: Gains in Economics Diversity Push
abstract: After a year of revelations about racism and sexism, the profession’s annual meeting reflected signs of progress, but also work to be done.
lead_paragraph: SAN DIEGO — When the nation’s economists gathered here over the weekend, the event looked different than in past years. There was a woman holding “office hours” to help victims of sexual harassment and abuse. Job interviews were no longer conducted in hotel rooms, where female candidates had long felt uncomfortable. There was a long list of panel discussions on racism and sexism in the profession.
